intro: Trichinium incanum var. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered trichinium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its slender, erect stems are often covered in a fine, whitish pubescence. The species is noted for its aromatic foliage, which contains compounds similar to those found in other members of the carrot family.
